title: Statusbar
body: The Status Bar plugin provides the ability to customize the appearance of the native mobile status bar, including setting visibility, background color, and more.
You can add the following preferences in your
(boolean, defaults to true). Make the statusbar overlay or not overlay the WebView at startup.
(color hex string, no default value). Set the background color of the statusbar by a hex string (#RRGGBB) at startup. If this value is not set, the background color will be transparent.
(status bar style, defaults to lightcontent). Set the status bar style (e.g. text color). Available options: default, lightcontent, blacktranslucent, blackopaque.

(boolean, defaults to false). On iOS, allows the Cordova WebView to use default scroll-to-top behavior. Defaults to false so you can listen to the "statusTap" event (described below) and customize the behavior instead.
: Manage the appearance of the native status bar.
Whether the StatusBar is currently visible or not.
Set the status bar to a specific hex color (CSS shorthand supported!).
iOS note: you must call StatusBar.overlaysWebView(false) to enable color changing.
The hex value of the color.
Set the status bar to a specific named color. Valid options: black, darkGray, lightGray, white, gray, red, green, blue, cyan, yellow, magenta, orange, purple, brown.
iOS note: you must call StatusBar.overlaysWebView(false) to enable color changing.
The name of the color (from above)
Set whether the status bar overlays the main app view. The default is true.
Whether the status bar overlays the main app view.
Use the blackOpaque statusbar (light text, for dark backgrounds).
Use the blackTranslucent statusbar (light text, for dark backgrounds).
Use the default statusbar (dark text, for light backgrounds).
Use the lightContent statusbar (light text, for dark backgrounds).
